e8416a4f-1b8c-40e3-8ee7-b046121595f5.description: The earner demonstrated knowledge of coding, algorithms and data structures while developing applications in Javascript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, jQuery and other front-end and back-end and back-end tools and technologies. Program instructional time was 250 hours and up to an additional 500 hours on projects.
e8416a4f-1b8c-40e3-8ee7-b046121595f5.name: Full Stack Developer

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education Coding Boot Camp and meet attendance requirements for the course (95%).

Learner has completed the portfolio project for this course.  The portfolio project is a functional web application with front-end and back-end components that meet a set of criterion as assessed by the instructor.

Portfolio project criteria: Uses ReactJS or Angular. Uses a Node and Express Web Server. Backed by a database with an ORM. Has both GET and POST routes for retrieving and adding new data. Deployed using Heroku. Uses two libraries, packages, or technologies not in curriculum. Authenticates users in some way. Polished frontend/UI. Folder structure that meets MVC Paradigm. Meets good quality coding standards.

Planning for the project includes the following criteria: Overview and value proposition
Detailed screen-by-screen design layouts with annotations describing UI/UX components and data relevant to the screen. Jira, Trello, or Project Management Board with tasks, milestones, and ownership.

5df93612-a64e-4637-b4ec-4a954e52a892.description: The earner of this badge has a demonstrated understanding of data preparation, analytics principles, visualization, algorithms, and data structures. The earner has worked with Javascript Leaflet, Python Pandas, Python Flask, MySQL Database, Tableau, HTML/CSS, and JavaScript Plotly. Program instructional time was 250 hours with up to an additional 500 hours spent on projects.
5df93612-a64e-4637-b4ec-4a954e52a892.name: Data Analytics Meta Skills Badge

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education Data Analytics Boot Camp and meet attendance requirements for the course (95%).
Complete the portfolio project for this course with a passing grade from the instructor. The portfolio project is an applied data analysis project with a digitally publishable data visualization.

Passing the portfolio project includes the following criteria: Applied Machine Learning in the context of technologies learned.  Uses sci-kit learn and/or another statistics/analytics library.  Utilizes both analysis and visualization.   Polished visualization. Meets good quality coding standards.

Portfolio project used at least two of the following technologies: Python Pandas, Python Matplotlib, Python Flask, HTML/CSS/Bootstrap, JavaScript Plotly, Javascript D3.js, JavaScript Leaflet, MySQL Database, MongoDB Database, Google Cloud SQL, Amazon AWS, Tableau.

Planning for the project includes the following criteria: Overview and value proposition. Detailed walkthrough of machine learning application. Jira, Trello, or Project Management Board with tasks, milestones, and ownership.

8681022f-6833-4a4c-93c2-2e8b823cb6ed.description: The earner of this badge has a demonstrated understanding of system administration and cybersecurity and has completed intensive training in network security monitoring, defensive security, and penetration testing. Program instructional time is 250 hours with up to an additional 500 hours on projects.
8681022f-6833-4a4c-93c2-2e8b823cb6ed.name: Networking and Cybersecurity

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Networking and Cybersecurity  course of UCD CPE Cybersecurity Bootcamp including completion with satisfactory score of all assignments, projects and supplemental activities, and has attended all required classes (95% attendance).

Pass projects and assignments including: Secure, configure, and harden servers. System administration. Automate security tasks. Monitor network traffic. Packet analysis. Analyze network tracing. Implement firewall policies. Traffic logs and alerts. Investigate network attack, application attack, and email attack incidents. Collect, preserve, analyze, and report forensic evidence. Penetration tests. Enumerate and scan networks. Manually identify and exploit vulnerabilities and construct payloads.

ca32b652-2bb5-428d-a3fe-0b06f35a7360.description: The earner of this badge has shown proficiency with Google Keyword Planner, Google Ads (for search and display campaigns), Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn Ads Managers, Wordpress, and CRM platforms. They are able to create marketing plans, generate and nurture leads through all marketing funnel phases, run retargeting campaigns, and enhance a website for search engine optimization.
ca32b652-2bb5-428d-a3fe-0b06f35a7360.name: UCD Digital Marketing Bootcamp

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the course; 18 weeks with 180 hours of instruction time.

92ea55db-e73d-4ea7-9d64-4a52f771fe41.description: UC Davis Lean Six Sigma curriculum leveraged a systems thinking approach and challenged existing mental models. The learner utilized a Lean Six Sigma approach from both a tactical and strategic perspective and they applied tools and theories to a specific use-case. The span of the studies included a process improvement project where the learner worked in a team to select, analyze and implement process improvement strategies with a project management and organizational change management approach.
92ea55db-e73d-4ea7-9d64-4a52f771fe41.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed attendance requirements for the course – 36 hours of in person training.

Learner has completed project based assignments – 36 hours or more of project work  Assignments Included:  - Project Proposal - Project Selection - Project Validation - Project Plan - Lean Sigma Frameworks - Insights and Recommendations

Learner led a process improvement project and presented on results and progress through a final stage gate presentation. The learner also received coaching and mentoring from Master Black Belts and peer Green Belts through the process.

056870d4-db9e-4daf-8849-71e035259d44.description: The earner of this badge has a working knowledge of population health management, healthcare data quality standards, and healthcare utilization and cost containment. They are able to work with statistical modeling, predictive analysis, SAS reporting, the basics of SQL programming and data mining standards and processes. This professional program is comprised of 15 units (150 hours) of academic credit; the five-course program takes approximately six months to complete.
056870d4-db9e-4daf-8849-71e035259d44.name: Healthcare Analytics Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education’s online Healthcare Analytics Certificate Program. This includes  five required courses (15 units), with a minimum grade of ‘C’ in each course and an overall average of ‘B’ or higher. Each course in the certificate requires a culminating project and/or a final exam.
Culminating projects are done in small groups with ongoing support from the teaching staff; they require the learner to demonstrate technical skills and conceptual understanding.

d07ba339-0f82-405c-8914-7c0646d21b34.description: The earner of this badge has advanced education and skills regarding how to control and improve the flavor of their beer. The earner understands the role of malt, hops, yeast and water in determining the aromas and taste of beer, as well as how to achieve the desired smell and taste of the end product.
d07ba339-0f82-405c-8914-7c0646d21b34.name: Beer Quality: Flavor

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Beer Quality: Flavor course from UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education and meet attendance requirements for the course (80%).
Successfully pass (80% or higher) a final exam which was comprised of 3 scenarios followed by corresponding quiz questions.

d6732191-542a-4809-8a33-a6a9ce82b169.description: Earners of this badge can write basic scripts in Python that utilize variables, data structures, and functions to interact with the operating system and process text files. The badge holder has demonstrated the use of modules in Python to interact with the operating system and has used Jupyter Notebooks for Python programming. The badge holder applied these skills in the Introduction to Python Programming course - completing 20 hours of instruction and 40 hours of hands-on project work.
d6732191-542a-4809-8a33-a6a9ce82b169.name: Python - Simple Script Writing

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education "Introduction to Python Programming", an Academic Credit-bearing course, with a grade of “C” or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of “C” or better. Assignments Included: - Using variable types, flow control, and functions - Interacting with the operating system via Python - Using Jupyter for Python development Assignments were graded by the course instructor.

The learner has completed a "writing simple scripts to process text" project with grade of “C” or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner applied knowledge of Python programming, worked in Jupyter Notebooks, wrote a script to process text, and tested and corrected the script until it worked to the assignment specification.

36087a57-7a5f-4837-94b1-53bec1c6679a.description: Earners of this badge can import and analyze data using Python. Along with applying basics of the python language, the badge holder was able to manipulate data using NumPy, produced plots and tested data visualizations with matplotlib, ran statistical analysis using Pandas. The badge holder applied these skills in the Python for Data Analysis course - completing 15 hours of instruction and 30 hours of hands-on project work.
36087a57-7a5f-4837-94b1-53bec1c6679a.name: Data Analysis with Matplotlib, Pandas, and Scikit-Learn Python Libraries

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education "Python for Data Analysis", an Academic Credit-bearing course, with a grade of “C” or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of “C” or better. Assignments Included: - Ingesting data, producing plots, analysis and fit models - Interacting with various Python libraries - Importing data and manipulate data using NumPy - Running a statistical analysis using pandas

The learner has completed a project with grade of “C” or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner was required to load, explore and clean data using Pandas. The learner was also required to manipulate and analyze data using the Pandas library. Finally, the learner had to visualize the data using matplotlib to create a graphic output.

aecc5bd7-9a36-4420-9e6c-78d18f75625b.description: The earner of this badge has advanced education and skills about beer foam and its scientific relationship and performance in a quality beer. The earner recognizes why foam is important; the underpinning physics and chemistry of foam; how to measure foam; and how to rectify poor foam performance.
aecc5bd7-9a36-4420-9e6c-78d18f75625b.name: Beer Quality: Foam

Successfully pass (80% or higher) a final exam which was comprised of 4 scenarios followed by corresponding quiz questions.

8171a529-c17e-48ba-8976-55dd2f36ef6f.description: The earner of this badge has advanced education and skills related to what quality really means and the practices that need to be put into place to ensure the production of a pleasing product every time. The earner is able to define quality, know what to measure and how; document raw materials and processes; and successfully establish a quality program no matter the size of the operation.
8171a529-c17e-48ba-8976-55dd2f36ef6f.name: Beer Quality: Quality Systems

The badge holder applied these skills in the Intermediate Python course - completing 20 hours of instruction and 40 hours of hands-on project work.

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed UC Davis Continuing and Professional Eduction "Intermediate Python", an Academic Credit-bearing course, with a grade of “C” or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of “C” or better. Assignments Included: - Exploring basics of object-oriented programming using Python classes - Testing Python Data Structures such as recursion, linear data structures, trees and graphs, maps and hash tables - Utilizing Python advanced language features for writing efficient programs Assignments were graded by the course instructor.

The learner has completed a "write and test a variety of functions or classes" project with grade of “C” or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner applied knowledge of Python programming and showed skills to write a linked list data structure.

39fdb435-a5f6-40ef-a529-e7197ac3afdb.description: Earners of this badge can effectively import, prepare, model and visualize data using the Python programming language. The badge holder has demonstrated the ability to utilize Python to deploy selected machine learning models. The badge holder applied these skills in the Data Preparation, Modeling, and Visualization with Python course - completing 20 hours of instruction and 40 hours of hands-on project work.
39fdb435-a5f6-40ef-a529-e7197ac3afdb.name: Data Modeling with Python

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has passed UC Davis Continuing and Professional Eduction "Data Preparation, Modeling, and Visualization with Python", an Academic Credit-bearing course with a grade of “C” or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of “C” or better. Assignments included: - Examining common data preparation tasks - Cleaning and visualizing data - Assessing efficient ways to explore data - Testing and evaluating predictive models using Python

The learner has completed a "data modeling" project with grade of “C” or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner applied knowledge of Python programming to implement various machine learning models (such as linear regression, logistic regression, and decision trees) using Scikit-learn.

99b3f31b-73ff-47c5-b331-01855a7bfe5f.description: The badge holder completed the UX/UI Boot Camp, a challenging, 24-week program that delivered a multidisciplinary approach to increased proficiency in design thinking, product management, user interface design, and web design. The badge holder worked with popular tools such as Adobe XD, Figma, and InVision, and essential methods including agile methodology, user-centered design research, and rapid prototyping.
99b3f31b-73ff-47c5-b331-01855a7bfe5f.name: UX/UI Design

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The badge holder worked in a simulated design studio team to execute a group design challenge with user research. The badge holder: * Developed empathy with users, interviewed users and synthesized data to develop user insights and potential application features. * Created a low-fidelity design through storyboarding, wireframes, and paper prototypes. * Tested the design with real users to gather feedback to improve it through rapid, iterative prototyping.

The badge holder applied graphic design methods to transform a low-fidelity prototype into a visually compelling user interface. The badge holder: * Used color theory, typography, and iconography to improve user experience. * Created a style guide so an entire design and development team could work on the application.

The badge holder: * Used UI analysis and accessibility evaluations to analyze a government website. * Created low-fidelity mock-ups for a new responsive website using best UX/UI practices like atomic design. * Applied user testing to develop a high-fidelity prototype in Adobe XD and Figma. * Utilized Bootstrap and basic HTML and CSS to create an interface to showcase the UX/UI projects in this course.

c1b5c137-ffc4-4278-988e-0086f6e01d1a.description: The earner of this badge has advanced education and skills related to why flavor stability matters, the positive and negative changes that can occur in beer over time and why these changes occur. The earner understands how to assess flavor change using their senses and other relatively simple methods, how to address raw materials and process in enhancing stability and how to prevent the skunking of beer.
c1b5c137-ffc4-4278-988e-0086f6e01d1a.name: Beer Quality: Freshness

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Beer Quality: Freshness course from UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education and meet attendance requirements for the course (80%).
Successfully pass (80% or higher) a final exam which was comprised of 3 scenarios followed by corresponding quiz questions.

9d61eea6-3444-478e-8679-03c8c02afd79.description: The earner of this badge is able to use data visualization tools and techniques to interpret and communicate data. The earner understands fundamental concepts of data visualization and use of Tableau capabilities for charting, trending, table calculation and mapping. The earner can apply Gestalt principles of visual design to visual communication and information design to develop and present their own analysis with Tableau.
9d61eea6-3444-478e-8679-03c8c02afd79.name: Basic Data Visualization with Tableau

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Data Visualization with Tableau course from UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education and meet attendance requirements for the course (80%+ attendance).
Complete the portfolio project for this course with passing grade from the instructor (80%). The portfolio project is a data visualization using Tableau.

Portfolio project includes the following criterion: Appropriate for the audience. Design is aesthetically pleasing, uncluttered, good use of color contrast, and represents data appropriately.  Sophisticated use of color, shapes, and sizes to communicate new information.  Effective use of Gestalt design principles.  Visual enhances the overall communication of the data to the user with appropriate balance of function and design.

Required use of table calculations. Required use of calculated fields. Required use of data source connections. Required use of data table merges. Required use of filters and/or parameters. Demonstrates clear understanding of data, analyses, charts and results.

Planning for the project and presentation of the project includes the following criterion: Write up of the project is concise and for the intended audience. Write up demonstrates clear understanding of project, analyses, and results.

9799968a-8160-4e20-a6c6-64ea288f4820.description: The earner of this badge has advanced education and skills regarding how to achieve the desired color and clarity of their beer. The earner understands why appearance matters; how to measure and control beer color; types of turbidity issues in beer; how to measure clarity and how it changes over time; the factors that impact beer clarity; and how to troubleshoot when things go wrong.
9799968a-8160-4e20-a6c6-64ea288f4820.name: Beer Quality: Color and Clarity

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Beer Quality: Color course from UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education and meet attendance requirements for the course (80%).
Successfully pass (80% or higher) a final exam which was comprised of 2 scenarios followed by corresponding quiz questions.

529a7598-485b-4b5b-917e-224ddd7ce1e9.description: Earners of this badge have performed complex data analysis and demonstrated the ability to create regression and cluster models in Python for data mining. The badge holder has shown advanced Python programming skills using built-in data structures in cloud computing environments to solve large data problems. The badge holder applied these skills in the Data Structures, Data Mining, and Big Data with Python course - completing 20 hours of instruction and 40 hours of hands-on project work.
529a7598-485b-4b5b-917e-224ddd7ce1e9.name: Data Mining with Python

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed the UC Davis Continuing and Professional Eduction "Data Structures, Data Mining, and Big Data with Python", an Academic Credit-bearing course, with a grade of “C” or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of “C” or better. Assignments Included: - Testing big data frameworks like Hadoop in Python for big data analysis & analytics - Applying Python advanced language features to write efficient programs - Applying advanced Python Data Structures for efficient handling of data - Python connectors to access and manipulate data - Analyzing data with Python pandas Assignments were graded by the course instructor.

The learner has completed a "data mining analysis" project with grade of “C” or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner had to run MapReduce on Amazon Web Services (AWS EMR) to show specific outputs, complete a series of tasks using built-in Python data structures, execute ETL with command line interface (Extract, Transform, and Load) and test Spark on EMR.

47af59fc-85a3-4bd6-8114-333bd6669c37.description: Being a certified UC Davis Team Coach for High-Value Results signifies that the learner is versed in the fundamentals of systemic team coaching, has been observed in their practice, and is prepared to build upon Systems Team Coaching for High-Value Results. The learner has achieved observed-practice in the foundations of ICF Core Competencies for Team Coaching and demonstrated skills for the most current published standards and ethics for Global professionals in the Systemic Team Coach.
47af59fc-85a3-4bd6-8114-333bd6669c37.name: Team Coaching for High-Value Results

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

alignments.name: ICF Team Coaching Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF model defines Team Coaching as partnering in a co-creative and reflective process with a team on its dynamics and relationships in a way that inspires them to maximize their abilities and potential to reach shared goals, guided by ICF Ethics.

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed the UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education "Team Coaching for High-Value Results" program and attended at least 50 hours of synchronous course activities.

Participated in at least 10 hours of observed team-coaching as well as completed a variety of assignments assessing Team Coaching Skills including, but not limited to: Demonstrating ability to co-create and steward team coaching agreements and contracts. Implement evidenced based theory and practices to cultivate psychological safety within a team. Utilize systemic and organizational thinking to evoke awareness and co-create with the team and stakeholder system for high-value results.
Developed and presented a portfolio of learning demonstrating a proficient understanding of principles and theories of Systemic Team Coaching for High-Value Results.

4324d7c8-4c68-4027-ae80-2d7c1017d6ae.description: Earners of this badge are able to code using Python scripting, syntax tools and object-oriented coding theories. They can utilize Python libraries, apply advanced Python language features, and integrate applications for data mining, data analytics and machine learning. The badge holder successfully completed the Python for Data Science, Web and Core Programming Professional Concentration - completing 95 hours of instruction and 190 hours of hands-on project work.

Learner completed assignment components in each course with a grade of "C" or better. Assignments Included: - Using Jupyter for Python development- Exploring basics of object-oriented programming- Testing and applying advanced Python data structures- Importing and manipulating data using NumPy- Running statistical analysis and analyzing data using Pandas- Data preparation, cleaning and visualization- Testing big data frameworks Assignments were graded by course instructors.

The learner has completed culminating projects with a grade of "C" or better as assessed by course instructor. Projects included:- Writing simple scripts to process text- Using advanced language features to write efficient programs- Writing and testing a variety of functions or classes- Loading, exploring and cleaning data using Pandas - Visualizing data using matplotlib to create graphic output- Running MapReduce on Amazon Web Services- Implementing Machine Learning models.

12a2eda0-a182-496c-b32e-20d66b51523b.description: The earner of this badge has an advanced understanding of business alignment, data preparation, analysis, calculation and visualization techniques to develop visual explanations that simplify complex data and make meaning of it. This person can create and present a portfolio-quality infographic, narrative or dashboard visualization that provides visual insight and explanation of the data.

The badge holder applied these skills in the Data Analytics with Excel course - completing 20 hours of instruction and 40 hours of hands-on project

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has passed UC Davis Continuing and Professional Eduction "Data Analytics with Excel", an Academic Credit-bearing course, with a grade of "C" or better.

Learner completed assignment components of the course with grade of "C" or better. Assignments Included: *Excel functions related to data preparation, sorting and filtering *Pivot tables, XLOOKUP and VLOOKUP *Business and finance data models *Case-specific analysis, including forecasting analysis, variance analysis and trend analysis. Assignments were graded by the course instructor.

The learner has completed a "Financial Analytics" course project with grade of "C" or better as assessed by the course instructor. In the project the learner applied knowledge of Excel to create an enterprise reporting and financial data analysis.

d00d32cc-6eb8-4cfc-8221-9105e345d7b6.description: Completing over 95 hours of live interactive learning, and 2 hours of personal executive coaching, earners of the UC Davis Executive Leadership badge have demonstrated a commitment to elevating their Leadership skills through in-depth self examination, discussion with industry-leading speakers, and the development of an Organizational Transformation Plan that utilizes their new learning to address issues the Leader may be currently facing in their organization.
d00d32cc-6eb8-4cfc-8221-9105e345d7b6.name: Executive Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has completed The UC Davis Executive Leadership Program at UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education.

Learner has actively participated in assigned activities, including: • Participation in the LPI 360 assessment with individualized Executive Coaching sessions on assessment results to examine their leadership strengths and identify blind spots. • Small group discussion of leadership styles, difficulties, and common issues across public and private sector business • Weekly small group meetings to network and assist each other with the development of their Organizational Transformation Plans
Developed and presented an Organizational Transformation Plan aimed at addressing issues the Leader is currently facing in their organization.

aa252e70-84b7-434d-91cd-ae294619503c.description: There are 5 course sections designed to build foundational California TK-12 policy knowledge and related skills. The five sections include: · Getting to Know California Students · Governance · Finance· Teaching and Learning · Accountability
aa252e70-84b7-434d-91cd-ae294619503c.name: California TK-12 Education Policy Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Quiz scores to demonstrate mastery of concepts described above.
Group-based activities to reinforce learning and apply it to theoretical learning.
Present ideas and concepts in discussion circles.

08c373b9-2b2d-4731-a362-3986384ad7f6.description: The earner of this badge has an advanced understanding of cybersecurity. The earner is able to think like an attacker, analyze network traffic and logs, conduct malware analysis, initiate digital forensics, and report findings to stakeholders. Program instructional time is 375 hours.
08c373b9-2b2d-4731-a362-3986384ad7f6.name: Cyber Defense

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Cyber Security Defense course of UCD CPE Cyber Security Immersion Academy.

Independently complete eight authentic cyber operations tasks achieving performance thresholds in: thinking like an attacker, network traffic analysis, network traffic analysis, log analysis, malware analysis, digital forensics, and appropriate reporting to stakeholders.

1fa61489-5781-4a56-b462-fbf2c5fd60fd.description: The earner of this badge has an advanced understanding of cybersecurity. They have an understanding of reverse engineering, open source intelligence analysis, exploiting application and server software, evading antivirus software, developing custom exploits, spearphishing, SQL injection, data exfiltration, and planning and executing a complex cyber attack. Program instructional time is 375 hours. Course enrollment is restricted to U.S. citizens and green card holders.
1fa61489-5781-4a56-b462-fbf2c5fd60fd.name: Cyber Attack

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Cyber Security Attack simulation within the UC Davis Cyber Security Immersion Academy.

Independently complete eleven authentic cyber operations tasks achieving performance thresholds in: reverse engineering, open source intelligence analysis, exploiting application and server software, evading antivirus software, developing custom exploits, Spearphishing, SQL injection, data exfiltration, and planning and executing a complex cyber attack.

3a7881eb-54cb-4976-8713-02428831ba4f.description: CEQA is the most comprehensive environmental law in the state of California. Understanding CEQA and its implication for your organization are essential when working on a project as a public agency member or even periodically as a private party. This badge consists of two required courses and three elective courses. Recipients of this badge will be eligible to receive a discount on "CEQA Update, Issues and Trends" when they enroll in the course within 24 months of the completion of the badge.
3a7881eb-54cb-4976-8713-02428831ba4f.name: CEQA Practitioner

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has successfully completed both core courses, CEQA: A Step-by-Step Approach & Successful CEQA Compliance: An Intensive Seminar. To complete a course, the learner must: review all online content, complete any required activities/quizzes/discussions, and attend the live session(s).

Learner has successfully completed three elective courses of their choosing. To complete a course, the learner must: review all online content, complete any required activities/quizzes/discussions, and attend the live session(s).
Learner must complete payments for each course.

02211a06-2203-4c92-aad3-c6654ebb2da3.description: Earners of the Emerging Leader badge have demonstrated the development of their own leadership skills by means of embracing change and a growth mindset, communicating with intent, and capitalizing on key decision-making as a leader. The badge holder applied these skills in the Emerging Leader Program, completing over 24 hours of interactive learning.
02211a06-2203-4c92-aad3-c6654ebb2da3.name: Emerging Leader Program

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has completed The Emerging Leader program at UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education

Learner has actively participated in assigned activities, including: • Demonstrated a thorough understanding of leadership and management • Fostered goals as a leader • Created an action plan to build more effective relationships using the insights from DiSC • Learned communication approaches to improve productivity • Promoted team development in rapidly evolving circumstances

Developed and presented a portfolio of learning demonstrating a proficient understanding of leadership and management, leading and managing others with intent, implementing improved methods of communication and promoting team building.

bf003df0-2a8f-44a5-a0cf-6fc09118adc7.description: The earner of this badge has learned about the complex and dynamic nature of caregiving, which includes the shared decision making, conflict resolution, how to identify personal biases and the multiple factors that influence caregiving situations. They are positioned to address the needs of diverse family caregivers and possess the knowledge to make systems change through leadership and research.
bf003df0-2a8f-44a5-a0cf-6fc09118adc7.name: Family Caregiving

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: Individual Learning: Learners will review six, four-hour asynchronous online modules that include tools and case studies. Modules serve to introduce the role of the caregiver and how to identify this person, theories around caregiving, tools to assess the ability of a caregiver, how to engage and improve communication with a caregiver, the concept of shared decision-making, and policy issues for caregivers.

Cohort Learning: After each asynchronous module, the learner will participate in six synchronous 90-minute online sessions. These synchronous sessions include lecture and participation, with a focus on how to implement the skills and tools presented in the online modules. These sessions allow the learner to delve deeper into content and, because they are part of a multi-disciplinary cohort, to observe how family caregiving practices are implemented by social workers, clinicians, and clergy.
The modules culminate with how to develop a co-created plan of care. In addition, course leaders will debrief and perform a learner evaluation which will be submitted to the Nurse Scholars Academy.

2ccb912b-8ffc-4b47-9050-6eefdc76f6d5.description: Earners of the Leadership Development for Construction Professionals badge have demonstrated a reflection of their own leadership style, articulate and leverage their top 5 Gallup strengths, how their strengths influence their communication and conflict resolution, practice bid presentation, and are knowledgeable on negotiation tactics. The badge holder applied these skills in the Leadership Development for Construction Professionals completing over 18 hours of interactive learning.
2ccb912b-8ffc-4b47-9050-6eefdc76f6d5.name: Leadership Development for Construction Professionals

issuer.summary: issued by UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

entity.name: UC Davis Division of Continuing and Professional Education

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has completed The Leadership Development for Construction Professionals program at UC Davis Continuing and Professional Education.

Learner has actively participated in assigned activities, including: • Demonstrated effective leadership and management strategies in contemporary work situations • Applied strengths-based leadership approaches to complex problems • Demonstrated a mock bid presentations • Used communication approaches grounded in coaching principles to foster team development • Promoted team development through a construction lens • Formed a personal negotiation tactics

Developed and presented a portfolio of learning demonstrating a proficient understanding of their own leadership style and strengths, leading with emotional intelligence, managing conflict in the workplace, communicating with intent, negotiation tactics, and Bid Presentation.

skills.name: team development through a construction lens

f071dbef-9e70-4fc8-943f-a103b7b73a69.description: Earners of the Management Development badge have demonstrated a reflection of their own leadership style, practice leading with emotional intelligence, apply effective strategies for managing conflict in the workplace, communicate with intent, promote resilience in individuals and teams, and serve as effective partners with C-Suite. Developed and presented a portfolio of learning demonstrating a proficient understanding of their own leadership style, leading with emotional intelligence, managing conflict in the workplace, communicating with intent, promoting resilience in individuals and teams, and serving as effective partners with C-Suite.
